Um jogo incrível, um pouco bugado, mas extemamente divertido e tem uma dificuldade considerável, comprei na promoção por 2 reais e foi um dinheiro muito bem gasto, me garantiu horas de diversão, então se procuras um jogo divertido com uma dificuldade considerável, compre-o.
An iconic game. It didn't age perfectly, but it given its age, it is more than decent even today. Consider buying "Black Mesa" which is a remake of this wonderful game.

Overall, this is an excellent game, it looks very good and has a great story. But as this is my first time playing, and I've never watched a walk through before, I had no idea what happened in the game apart from the very basic premise. 

My main gripe, which is in my opinion a big one, is that for a new player like myself with no prior knowledge of the game, playing it and progressing can be difficult at times. Sure, some of the puzzles I should've guessed, but other ones I had absolutely no idea what to do or where to go and would have to consult with a Youtube video to find out what to do next. The game doesn't really seem to give you any pointers, just leaves you on your own to get frustrated at what on earth do you have to do to advance.
For me, this does ruin the game quite a bit as instead of just enjoying playing through the story and completing the puzzles I am frustrated and lost. I'm sure this might be partly to do with the fact that I don't really play story-style games, but nonetheless I think that is a serious flaw of the game.

If you enjoy sci-fi, adventure and action and don't mind getting frustrated often, this is the game for you.

If you're just looking for a chilled out sci-fi or adventure game that is easy to follow, Half Life is probably not going to be as good of an experience as people rave about.

For me, I still enjoy the game, not as much as I was expecting but I am still enthusiastic to play it.

7.5/10

Una joya, un buen juego que marcó la industria de los FPS para siempre del cual salió otro gran juego (counter strike). Es de temática similar a DOOM, ya que debes abrirte paso a través de múltiples enemigos de otro planeta que no dudarán en atacarte en cuanto te vean. No hay mucho que pueda decir aparte de lo que ya se ha dicho por otras personas, excepto que debes jugarlo sí o sí, es un título que debes tener si te gusta una buena historia detrás y no solo jugar y disparar a todo lo que aparece sin tener idea de por qué lo haces aparte de que debes defenderte. 1000000% recomendado

I'd heard about Half Life before, and I'd heard about how fun it was. Yet, I wasn't sure how much I would get out of game like this. I guess that's why you shouldn't judge a book by its cover...

I've had a blast playing this game. While it is a bit antiquated by today's standards, that didn't change my level of enjoyment for this title. I had a great time solving puzzles, fighting enemies, and working my way through the levels of this game. If you get a chance to play this game, you definitely should.

The Half-Life game series is arguably the most influential in the PC gaming industry. It starts in 1998, most of the popular games at the time were Quake and Doom. In those games you play as super soldiers. Super hero-like characters with powerful strength. When Half-Life came out, you literally spawned playing as “man on his way to work”. It was a new concept compared to any other game, and even more relatable to the player. You didn't have super-strength, you didn't have mind-control. You were a normal scientist with a hazard suit. The suit, named HEV suit or Hazardous Environment Suit. It was the only real power that the main character, Gordon Freeman had at his disposal. It's a suit that's not meant for war, simply working in hazardous environments. 

	When you start the game, you are greeted with a long train ride to your workplace. You are Gordon Freeman, a man with a PhD in Theoretical Physics. Along the train ride, you witness the advanced AI. You see NPCs (Non Playable Characters) at work, at break and interacting with each other. Having normal human conversations, such as “Do you know who ate all the doughnuts?” And generally complaining about work environments or equipment failures. 

	You work at Black Mesa Research Facility, a government facility located in the New Mexico desert. It's a top secret facility working on all sorts of super cool futuristic technologies. A massive underground facility with housing, amenities and even their own TV and news entertainment. They have a small security force that works all over the facility to protect it from any failed Frankenstein-like experiments.

	When you arrive at your train stop, you are greeted by a friendly security guard who lets you out of your train and warns you that you are late to work and they are soon going to start a big experiment. Once freed from the train car, you enter the lobby of Sector C. You are then greeted by NPCs who tell you that you are late and must go to the test chamber. Once you have put on the HEV Suit and arrived at the test chamber, you begin the experiment. As predicted, it goes very wrong. You unintentionally create a portal to another planet prompting the native species to invade earth.

	Fighting your way through the facility, you learn that the military has been ordered to cover up everything. They do this by eliminating everyone associated with the failed experiment. When the military fails, the CIA special forces are there to do the same thing. They are even ordered to eliminate the leftover military forces who originally failed. All while this is happening, the player is mysteriously stalked by a man known as The G-Man. A tall pale man in a blue suit carrying a black leather briefcase. Nothing is really known about him and how he relates to the main game, but it's speculated that he plays a major role.

	I rate Half-Life 10/10. It is an absolute perfect RPG with an engaging story. Although at the time it took them 6 years to release Half-Life 2, I was not born yet so it did not affect me! I got to play the half life series back to back and I enjoyed every bit of it! I’ve bonded with many friends over the Half-Life series and even the games based off of Half-Life such as the Counter-Strike series, HL Deathmatch, Ricochet, Day Of Defeat and Gary’s Mod. All great games that originally started with Half-Life, a game about a man who had a bad day at work.

öncellikle oyuna daha önce inceleme yazmış ve beğenmiş birisi olarak oyunu tekrar oynayıp bitirdim ve artık half life kötü bir oyun olduğunu düşünmekteyim bunu sizlere ''neden'' der iseniz elimden geldikçe iyi açıklamaya çalışacağım

Öncellikle Half Life konusunun ne kadar tembel yazıldığını anlamış oldum ne demek istediğimizi anlamıyor iseniz oyun da uzaylı istilası oluyor ve askerler ise size ihanet ederek sizi öldürmeye çalışıyor bu kendine özgün bir konu değil bu tamamen 1979 yılın da çıkmış Alien Filminin Konusunun aynısı! gidin ve o filmi izleyin aynı olaylar orada da yaşanmakta! ben buna tembel hikaye ve alien filminden çakma bir hikaye olarak değerlendiririm şahsen ve acayip kötü derim

Oyunun Gameplay gelir isek artık oynadığım zamandan mı kaynaklı umurum da değil ama silah kullanımı çok tekrara düşüyor oyun da yeni silah bulmanız bir bölüm başı zaten 3 saat falan sürüyor lan ve bölüm dizaynları da çok sıkıcı yapıldığından dolayı adam akıllı zevk de alamıyorsunuz ve bazı silahlar diğer silahların sadece modellerinin değiştirilmiş hali

oyun da ki ana karakterin hiç bir kişiliği olmayan bir ana karakterden ibaret bu oyunu benim için kat kat sıkıcı yaptı aynı bok metro da var bak

oyunun yapay zekası bok gibi düşmanları öldürmek o kadar kolay hale geliyor ki hiç bir zevk alamıyorum anasını satayım ve evet tamamen hard mod da oynamış birisi olarak diyorum bunu

kısaca ben oynanmaya değmez ve sevmedim diyorum artık hocam
